thread.title: NFL hot seat coaching index: Jaguars' Gus Bradley stacking losses
thread.title_full: NFL hot seat coaching index: Jaguars' Gus Bradley stacking losses

title: NFL hot seat coaching index: Jaguars' Gus Bradley stacking losses
text:
NFL hot seat coaching index: Jaguars' Gus Bradley stacking losses Jaguars' Bradley looks to be in trouble if he keeps piling up losses. Post to Facebook NFL hot seat coaching index: Jaguars' Gus Bradley stacking losses Jaguars' Bradley looks to be in trouble if he keeps piling up losses. Check out this story on USATODAY.com: http://usat.ly/1LIYueu Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. 2 To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs NFL hot seat coaching index: Jaguars' Gus Bradley stacking losses Nate Davis , USA TODAY Sports 6:34 p.m. EDT October 20, 2015 Gus Bradley's Jaguars have dropped four in a row. (Photo: Reinhold Matay, USA TODAY Sports) 78 CONNECT 75 TWEET LINKEDIN 2 COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
As the temperatures cool, the NFL coaching hot seat is warming up. Here is our weekly ranking of the coaches in most danger of losing their jobs when the season ends: 
1. Gus Bradley, Jacksonville Jaguars : We love your enthusiasm, Gus, but 8-30 ain't gonna cut it ... even in Jacksonville. 
Last week: 4 
2. Andy Reid, Kansas City Chiefs: Over the last four-plus seasons, Reid's teams have gone 33-38 and haven't won a playoff game. 
Last week: 2 
3. Jim Caldwell, Detroit Lions: Temporarily benching Matthew Stafford and using fake punts? Looks like Caldwell may be starting to push the right buttons with his team finally finding the win column. 
Last week: 1 
4. Chuck Pagano, Indianapolis Colts: Your team finally played the Pats tough, but that gets overshadowed by that fake punt thing. Losing high stakes gambles means lowered chances you're back with Indy in 2016. 
Last week: 7 
5. Jay Gruden, Washington Redskins: With Kirk Cousins plateauing, at best, and Andy Dalton making a quantum leap without him, Gruden's rep as a quarterback whisperer coming under further scrutiny. 
Last week: 6 
6. Ken Whisenhunt, Tennessee Titans: He shouldn't have exposed Marcus Mariota to further injury. He should look in the mirror after leading the Titans to consecutive 1-4 starts. 
Last week: Not ranked 
7. Lovie Smith, Tampa Bay Buccaneers: The bye cools the hot seat. A matchup with Washington could bring further relief. 
Last week: 3 
Dropped out (for now): Chip Kelly, Philadelphia Eagles 
Follow Nate Davis on Twitter @ByNateDavis
